abstracts.cdata!:
This paper points out that Payment for
            Environmental Services (PSA) was conceived as a new
            management tool, additional to the existing command and
            control, in order to facilitate the restoration and special
            conservation of native vegetation and the conversion of
            conventional models for production systems more sustainable
            in areas of environmental importance. In this context, the
            state of São Paulo decided to develop a statewide program of
            PSA, and the Mine Water Project pioneered the example that
            should provide information to guide the continuity of
            actions, especially regarding the arrangements for the
            implementation and formatting of upcoming projects.
